intro: Eriogonum vimineum var. multiradiatum, commonly known as the multiradiate buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pink to reddish in color, and it produces small, three-angled fruits. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water.
